str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

word: did not take upon Himself the glory
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
